column4: of course it depends on what you're wanting it for, but I was just messing w/ ebox and it pretty much handles all setup and config for you
does webmin do that? I have webmin installed...
that note just posted re: Webmin is why I was playing w/ ebox
I'm looking at ebox now. there's quite a few in software center. is there a "download ebox" and get all of the above option?
I understand webmin is popular w/ its adherents, but I think it only works on older versions of Ubuntu, (maybe 8.04???)
works terrific on 10.04. I've had zero issues and use it extensively on production servers at work.
what does "not supported" mean? It's in the software center... *shrug*
interesting.
well the note says it has an incompatible way of handling packages.
If its like ebox (never used it) you log into it by giving the https://<ip address of the machine>/ebox
the medibuntu site includes non-free software.
I get the login by https://<ipnumber>/ebox in my browser

thanks. I think I forgot something. I selected ebox common or w/e in software ctr thinking it'd grab everything, but it didnt. I forgot you need to either install individually or apt-get ebox-* or whatever t download ebox + all ebox modules. doing that now
the curve ball was the S - need https not http. :P
is there a lamp module for ebox?
yeah, the 's' fooled me at first too.
well under the covers the web server is Apache (the A)
lets see, remind me the other L, M,P are again?
I have no idea - I just told my buddy I wanted to share out files FTP-style but not FTP and he said use LAMP.
hmmm... I wonder if they meant http or something.  I know ebox provides file sharing AND ftp (distinguishes between).
also, do you know if ebox can suck up the current samba setup? I have samba set up here and ebox isnt detecting my shares/users/etc.
great question.  Sorry I don't know.  Just started playing w/ it myself.
